resources.string: You\'re about to forward a secure message as unsecure. If you choose to proceed, confidential information might be leaked putting you and your communication partners at risk. Are you sure you want to continue?
Look up keys on key server
Ask your partner in person or over the phone: What are your Trustwords\? Then compare to the correct answer shown below.
The following secret key was received. Are you sure you want to use it?
p≡p - Trust server and store mails unprotected
Store serverside mails in a safe form.
Enable p≡p privacy protection for this account
Show a warning when a message loses security through reply or forward.
K-9/p≡p is a powerful free email client for Android with pretty Easy privacy.
You are about to add a device to another p≡p device group. Confirm by successfully verifying the following Trustwords.
You are about to move a device to another p≡p device group. Confirm by successfully verifying the following Trustwords.
Warning: This communication partner was previously marked as mistrusted. Are you sure you want to continue with another handshake?
Synchronize these accounts between my devices
We need your permission to read the contacts stored on your mobile phone
We need your permission to read the contacts stored on your mobile phone
Not allowing us read your contacts may cause unexpected behaviour
We need your permission to download files on your mobile phone
We need your permission to save attachments from your emails.
Not allowing us download files may cause unexpected behaviour
In order to synchronize your emails in the background we need to disable battery optimizations
To be able to use this account you should add it to your device
Your device seems to be offline, please check your connection before you can continue
Not granting the needed permissions may cause unexpected behaviors. Press OK to grant them to us.

string-array.name: pep_explanation
string-array.item: This message does not contain enough information to determine if it is secure.
This message cannot be decrypted because the key is not available.
This message is unsecure for some communication partners.
This message is secure but you still need to verify the identity of your communication partner.
This message is secure and trusted.
This message is secure and trusted.
This message is secure and trusted.
This message has a communication partner that has previously been marked as mistrusted.
This message is not secure and has been tampered with.

string-array.name: pep_suggestion
string-array.item: If this message was addressed to you, please inform the sender that you don\'t have the key.
If this message was addressed to you, please inform the sender that you don\'t have the key.
Please ask your communication partner to use an encryption solution or install p≡p.
Make sure the privacy status for each communication partner listed is at least secure.
This message has no reliable encryption or no signature. Ask your communication partner to upgrade their encryption solution or install p≡p.
Complete a handshake with your communication partner. A handshake is needed only once per partner and will ensure secure and trusted communication.
Re-establish the connection with your communication partner and try to complete another handshake.
Separately verify the content of this message with your communication partner.

resources.string: Please enter or select a valid filename
Message rating is still loading, try again
Please compare the following Trustwords with the ones on your other device and confirm if they match.
We are about to start the key import process: This will import and use your p≡p key from another device, and export your private key.
You are about to start the key import process from a PGP client
A message with your public p≡p key has been sent to yourself. Please open this message on your PGP device and import your public p≡p key into your keychain.
In your PGP device, create an answer message to the one you received from p≡p and attach your public PGP key.
Encrypt and sign the answer message with the public p≡p key you just imported and send it.
Please compare the PGP fingerprints of the below keys with the ones on your PGP device and confirm if they match.
In your PGP device, create another answer message to the one you received from p≡p. This time, please attach your private PGP key.
Encrypt and sign the answer message again with the public p≡p key and send it.

To proceed with the Key Import, please import the attached public p≡p key and reply with a message that: 



1. has your public PGP key attached and 
 2. is encrypted and signed with the p≡p key you just imported
If you initiated a key import for the following account: %s, please click Start.
Failed to import and use any key from %1$s with key id: %2$s
Please enter the Key ID or the fingerprint of the key.
Reset all p≡p data for this communication partner:
All p≡p data for this communication partner has been reset.
All p≡p accounts have been reset.
This action will reset all your accounts. \n Are you sure you want to reset?
This action will reset your account. \n Are you sure you want to reset?

You can close this tutorial any time.

<font color="#4caf50">p≡p</font> uses a Privacy Status to indicate how secure your communication is.

This Privacy Status is shown as an icon in the user's avatar
And in the top bar when you open or write an e-mail:
With this Privacy Status all communication is Secure, but to confirm that your contact is really the person you know, you should Trustwords with this contact.
When the Trustwords are confirmed to be correct and the Handshake is done, the communication will be completely secure and trusted.
If the Trustwords are not correct, your communication partner is Mistrusted.
When you click on the Privacy Status icon in the top bar, you will get to the Handshake, where you can verify your communication partner.
Complete a handshake with your communication partner. A handshake is needed only once per partner and will ensure Secure and Trusted communication.
The icon in the top bar reflects the Privacy Status of the message, which is the lowest common denominator of all communication partners of that message, for example:
In this case the Privacy Status of the message is Secure, because this is the lowest common denominator of the two communication partners.
This is an own message, no other communication partner involved.
Please make sure uou have both devices together so you can compare the Trustwords on both devices. Are the Trustwords below equal to the Trustwords on the other device?
Please give us a moment while we sync your devices. This can take a minute or more.
Something went wrong with syncing the devices. Please try again.
A second device was detected. We can form a device group to sync all your privacy on both devices. Shall we start synchronizing\?
We successfully created a device group. All your privacy is now synchronized.
Another device was detected. We can add it to your device group to sync all your privacy on all devices. Shall we start synchronizing?
The device is now member of your device group. All your privacy is now synchronized.
We could not protect this message.
We could not protect this message.
We didn\'t send it and saved it to the draft folder instead.
If you disable p≡p Sync your accounts on your devices will not be synchronized anymore.\nAre you sure you want to disable p≡p Sync\?
Doesn\'t attach a pEpkey.asc if your communication partner is not using p≡p
Encrypt the message subject when writing to a communication partner with OpenPGP
Blacklist a key of an OpenPGP communication partner not to use it anymore
Stores encrypted messages encrypted on the server.
Encrypted messages will be decrypted and stored unencrypted on the server.
